subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] No evidence is accptable!?
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_7717f7e7-d4cf-42e1-8093-3ae0658facca_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Lisby,
 
No one was perpitrating an outrage fest the only thing I was insin=
uating was that in the 
begging for everyone including myself evp is very h=
ard to recognize and interpret even by 
a seasoned pro like yourself. I wis=
h there were people around when I started with evp research 
to lend a hand=
 and some constructive criticism so I didn't have to flounder around for su=
ch a long 
time trying to figure it out on my own. I'm sure if dave felt he=
 was being unduely crircised he would have spoken up himself.
 
Bruce
 

Br=
uce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFr=
om: lisby@...: Sun, 28 Oct 2007 13:32:42 -0400Subject: Re: [E=
VP-ITC] No evidence is accptable!?




Hey guys, not to interrupt the outra=
gefest here, but there are times when what you're seeing and hearing just d=
oesn't agree with what someone else does. There where times when, for examp=
le, when a late member of another group showed me pictures where he was abs=
olutely sure they showed something paranormal and all I saw was zip--someti=
mes not even enough to blame it on pattern recognition. We'd argue until th=
e old saw was trotted out, "You skeptics don't believe anything." I'd alway=
s assure him that I did, in fact, accept the reality of EVP, life after dea=
th, UFOs, time travel, and any number of other paranormal issues, and just =
because I did not perceive one piece of potential evidence was actually evi=
dence, it was very unfair to tar and feather me. 

There have been times wh=
en I heard a clear EVP and no one else did and times that others insisted t=
hey clearly heard one and I did not. (And I have to add that sometimes list=
ening for EVPs amidst a long stream of bandwidth tuning diminishes them for=
 me--it makes them sound much more likely to be broadcast fragments. Unless=
 you have good headphones and are listening very carefully to each syllable=
, it sounds like junk.) 

Also, please keep in mind that when you solicit a=
 stranger's opinion, you need to accept the fact that you may not get the v=
alidation you are looking for. I get hundreds of supposed paranormal pics s=
ent to me each year. 99.9 are camera artifacts. I only write back to the on=
es I think may be possibly paranormal because if I write back and say it is=
 a camera artifact, then I end up in a slanging match with the person who s=
ent it and I assure you that every conversation includes the sentence "Well=
, you skeptics don't believe anything!"

I don't know this person that all =
the slanging is going on about here, but I do know that he, like me, simply=
 may not hear it, may not want to be involved for whatever reason, or may j=
ust be in a bad mood that someone is demanding he agree with them when he h=
onestly doesn't. There is nothing wrong with that. It doesn't make him the =
twin brother of James Randi or even a simple skeptic.

Have some mercy on p=
eople who don't see with you eye to eye. Agree to disagree. Be good to each=
 other, for chrissakes. This is not an all-or-nothing issue. And I think th=
at once you come to the conclusion that you have experienced enough high st=
rangeness to know, without a doubt, that the basic fact that the Other Side=
 and far more exists, then the need for every possible piece of evidence to=
 be real fades away. We're not looking for evidence. We have it already. We=
're looking for the best evidence possible.

/rant

Ann



On Oct 26, 2007,=
 at 10:07 AM, Zack Widup wrote:




He's not a debunker. A real debunker wo=
uld actually look at the evidence and try to find natural explanations with=
in his frame of knowledge.This guy is an idiot.ZackOn Fri, 26 Oct 2007, Fra=
nk Sumption wrote:>> This guy won't even look at, or see any evidence, He's=
 a debunker, I just wanted to prod him some. I can't even answer wirthout g=
etting real nasty, so I'll just drop it.>> Frank>>> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.comFrom: w9sz@...: Thu, 25 Oct 2007 16:16:07 -0500Subject: =
RE: [EVP-ITC] No evidence is accptable!?>> Good question ... just take the =
photo, show it to someone without telling them ANYTHING about it and ask th=
em what they see.I did that with someone at work and he said he saw the top=
s of two heads down to the lips, and below that another image of just lips =
and chin.ZackOn Thu, 25 Oct 2007, Kristin Morris wrote:> Maybe he is James =
Randi?s brother?>> k>>>> _____>> From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com[mailto:EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of> Zack Widup> Sent: Thursday, October 25, 2=
007 2:43 PM> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] No evidenc=
e is accptable!?>>>>> How could anybody NOT see anything in that photo? It'=
s as plain as the> nose on my face!!!>> Zack>> On Thu, 25 Oct 2007, Frank S=
umption wrote:>>>>> So I just the guy this, bet he says he can't see a thin=
g in this picture> either.>>>> Frank>>>>>>>

Hey guys, not to interrupt the outragefest here, but there=
 are times when what you're seeing and hearing just doesn't agree with what=
 someone else does. There where times when, for example, when a late member=
 of another group showed me pictures where he was absolutely sure they show=
ed something paranormal and all I saw was zip--sometimes not even enough to=
 blame it on pattern recognition. We'd argue until the old saw was trotted =
out, "You skeptics don't believe anything." I'd always assure him that I di=
d, in fact, accept the reality of EVP, life after death, UFOs, time travel,=
 and any number of other paranormal issues, and just because I did not perc=
eive one piece of potential evidence was actually evidence, it was very unf=
air to tar and feather me. 
<DIV><BR class=3DEC_khtml-block-placeholder></D=
IV>
<DIV>There have been times when I heard a clear EVP and no one else did=
 and times that others insisted they clearly heard one and I did not. (And =
I have to add that sometimes listening for EVPs amidst a long stream of ban=
dwidth tuning diminishes them for me--it makes them sound much more likely =
to be broadcast fragments. Unless you have good headphones and are listenin=
g very carefully to each syllable, it sounds like junk.) 
<DIV><BR class=3D=
EC_khtml-block-placeholder></DIV>
<DIV>Also, please keep in mind that when =
you solicit a stranger's opinion, you need to accept the fact that you may =
not get the validation you are looking for. I get hundreds of supposed para=
normal pics sent to me each year. 99.9 are camera artifacts. I only write b=
ack to the ones I think may be possibly paranormal because if I write back =
and say it is a camera artifact, then I end up in a slanging match with the=
 person who sent it and I assure you that every conversation includes the s=
entence "Well, you skeptics don't believe anything!"</DIV>
<DIV><BR class=
=3DEC_khtml-block-placeholder></DIV>
<DIV>I don't know this person that all=
 the slanging is going on about here, but I do know that he, like me, simpl=
y may not hear it, may not want to be involved for whatever reason, or may =
just be in a bad mood that someone is demanding he agree with them when he =
honestly doesn't. There is nothing wrong with that. It doesn't make him the=
 twin brother of James Randi or even a simple skeptic.</DIV>
<DIV><BR class=
=3DEC_khtml-block-placeholder></DIV>
<DIV>Have some mercy on people who don=
't see with you eye to eye. Agree to disagree. Be good to each other, for c=
hrissakes. This is not an all-or-nothing issue. And I think that once you c=
ome to the conclusion that you have experienced enough high strangeness to =
know, without a doubt, that the basic fact that the Other Side and far more=
 exists, then the need for every possible piece of evidence to be real fade=
s away. We're not looking for evidence. We have it already. We're looking f=
or the best evidence possible.</DIV>
<DIV><BR class=3DEC_khtml-block-placeh=
older></DIV>
<DIV>/rant</DIV>
<DIV><BR class=3DEC_khtml-block-placeholder><=
/DIV>
<DIV>Ann</DIV>
